original: Brorström, Birger Magnus, läroverksadjunkt, Göteborg, f. 5/3/87 i Ri-iseberga, Krist. 1., av jägmäst. C. J. V. B. o. h. h. f. Carlson. G. 1. 16 m. Katarina Elisabet Lundberg, d. 26; 2. 28 m. Ingeborg Elisabeth Stjernholm. Barn: Sverker f. 17, fil. mag., Gbg, Carl-Magnus 19, fil. mag.,’ Uddevalila, Margareta 29. — Mog:ex. i Hälsingborg 05, fil. kand. i Lund 12, fil. mag. 14, provår v. Gbgs h. latin 15. Stud:-resa t. Tyskl. 11. Vik. adj. v. Hälsingborgs gosslärov. 10 o. 11, i Luleå 14, vik. adj. samt e. lär. v. Gbgs h. latin. 16-30, timlär. v. Lundénska priv:-sk. i Gbg 19-30, Gbgs gymn. f. bdiv. präster 24-28, adj. v. Malmö gosslärov. 30, adj. i hist. m. sam!h:lära o. geogr. v. Vasa h. a. 1. i Gbg sed. 36. Led. av styr. f. Gbgs lär:sällsk. 20-28, ordf. i Gbgskretsen av Sv. extralär :fören. 20-29, num. hed :iled. i sistn. Hobbieis: schack o. bridge.
translated: Brorström, Birger Magnus, high school teacher, Gothenburg, born on March 5, 1887 in Ri-iseberga, Krist. 1., son of forester C. J. V. B. and his wife Carlson. Married 1st to Katarina Elisabet Lundberg, died at age 26, married 2nd to Ingeborg Elisabeth Stjernholm, has three children: Sverker born in 1917, holds a Master of Arts from Gothenburg University, Carl-Magnus born in 1919, holds a Master of Arts from Uddevalla, Margareta born in 1929. Completed teacher's examination in Helsingborg in 1905, Bachelor of Arts in Lund in 1912, Master of Arts in 1914, one year as trainee teacher in Gothenburg high school in Latin in 1915. Conducted study trip to Germany in 1911. Temporary teacher in Hälsingborg boys' school in 1910 and 1911, in Luleå in 1914, temporary and permanent teacher in Latin in Gothenburg from 1916 to 1930, hourly teacher at Lundén's private school in Gothenburg from 1919 to 1930, teacher for priests at Gothenburg Gymnasium from 1924 to 1928, teacher in history, social studies, and geography at Vasahuset in Gothenburg since 1936. Member of the board of Gothenburg Teachers' Association from 1920 to 1928, chairman of the Gothenburg section of the Swedish Extra Teachers' Association from 1920 to 1929, now a honorary member of the same. Hobbies: chess and bridge.
